page.title: 01Scene of South East Somerset
page.content: _Grassland husbandry plays an important part in this rural area of dairy and livestock farming. Averaging 100 acres these family units support about 1 cow per acre. The fields are divided by ancient hedges, containing large hedgerow trees, and ditches, the land lying wet in the witer. Wooded areas, remains of the ancient deciduous Forests of Selwood are gradually being replaced by conifers. The site of the Norman Ballands castle is still apparent as a grassy mound. The villages of Charlton Musgrove and Penselwood are scattered communities. The 12c church at Charlton Musgrove still stands, togethr with a smaller 19c one. The church at Pelselwood is 15c. Individual new houses are being built. Apart fromt he farming communities, residents are mainly retired people
